sentences.english: He frowns upon things like that .
sentences.chinese: 他对那样的事情是皱眉头的。

sentences.english: Rebete, frowning at a puddle on a sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 他对着人行道上的一摊“水”直皱眉头。

sentences.english: He scowled at me when i asked for more money.
sentences.chinese: 当我要求再多一点钱时，他向我皱眉。

sentences.english: The drowsy browser knits its brows to browbeat the frowzy crow.
sentences.chinese: 昏昏欲睡的吃草动物皱眉头恐吓邋遢的乌鸦。

sentences.english: Lori , Lori wrinkled and said "nah…" to the mushroom.
sentences.chinese: 萝莉，萝莉皱眉说香菇不好吃。
听到这句话，范妮皱了皱眉。

sentences.english: If he could frown, he would.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以皱眉，他可以那样做。

sentences.english: The teacher grimaced as he looked at my work.
sentences.chinese: 教师看着我的作业时皱了皱眉头。

sentences.english: I put a fake frown on my face.
"And what are you going to do with the nice new frown?" the Pugilist asked.
sentences.chinese: “那么你打算如何处理好新皱眉？”的拳拳师问道。

sentences.english: And I think that a lot of Kenyan mothers as well would frown upon hearing that someone had a tattoo.
sentences.chinese: 而且我想，很多肯尼亚母亲听说谁纹了身都会皱眉头。

sentences.english: She wrinkled her brows in concentration.
And  what  are  you  going  to  do  with  the  nice  new  frown?
sentences.chinese: 那你要拿这个崭新美丽的皱眉做什么呢？

definition: to have heard what was said
to force a smile/a bitter laugh
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to sneer/to laugh grimly/grin of dissatisfaction (bitterness, helplessness, indignation etc)/bitter, grim, sarcastic or angry smile
